intro: Suessenguthia vargasii var. vargasii, commonly known as the Vargas's suessenguthia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, often in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
